info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:23PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pima County through 415 PM MST... At 322 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Flowing Wells, or 7 miles south of Oro Valley, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rainfall and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tucson, Oro Valley, Marana, Casas Adobes, Flowing Wells, Tortolita and Catalina Foothills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 245 and 259. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
